p: Antibiotics may be considered for treatment of Campylobacter spp. infections in severe cases [ 1]. The commonly used drugs to treat campylobacteriosis in humans are erythromycin, fluoroquinolones, or tetracycline [ 10]. Although this antimicrobial treatment is generally not necessary, misuse of antibiotics is common in Sub-Saharan Africa and this is leading to increasing antibiotic resistance [ 10â€“ 13].
